metadata.description: Encyclopedia Angelorum et Daemonum - Full Archive

entries.name: Michael
entries.description: Michael stands as the preeminent warrior among all angels. He is explicitly called 'one of the chief princes' and 'the great prince who stands guard over the sons of your people'. He serves as the primary antagonist to the forces of darkness, the divine warrior who executes God's judgments.

entries.name: Gabriel
entries.description: Gabriel serves as God's primary herald, entrusted with delivering the most significant announcements in salvation history. Unlike Michael who wages war, Gabriel wields the weapon of divine communication, bringing understanding to confusion and revelation to mystery.

entries.name: Raphael
entries.description: Raphael embodies God's compassionate care, serving as the celestial physician. In 1 Enoch, he is commissioned to bind Azazel and 'heal the earth'. He acts not merely to heal victims but to restrain the victimizers.

entries.name: Uriel
entries.description: Uriel stands as the archangel of divine illumination. He carries the flame of enlightenment and the scroll of knowledge. He is the celestial teacher par excellence, revealing mysteries about creation, judgment, and the movements of celestial bodies.

entries.name: Sariel / Suriel
entries.description: Sariel serves as one of the seven archangels, often associated with judgment and the lunar calendar. His specific assignment is 'over the spirits of those who sin against the spirit', suggesting a role in judging spiritual corruption.

entries.name: Raguel
entries.description: Raguel holds a unique position as the enforcer of divine order among the angels themselves. He takes vengeance on the world of the luminaries, ensuring that celestial beings fulfill their duties.

entries.name: Remiel / Jeremiel
entries.description: Remiel serves as the archangel of resurrection and hope. He is 'set over those who rise', making him the herald of humanity's ultimate hope that death is not the end.

entries.name: Metatron
entries.description: Metatron stands as the greatest angel in Jewish mystical tradition, serving as God's scribe. Many identify him as the patriarch Enoch transformed into an angel after being taken to heaven.

entries.name: Raziel
entries.description: Raziel is the angel of mysteries who stands near God's throne recording all divine secrets. He gave Adam the Sefer Raziel containing all knowledge of the universe.

entries.name: Azrael
entries.description: Azrael separates the soul from the body at death. Despite his fearsome role, he is often described as serving with compassion and accuracy.

entries.name: Satan / Sammael
entries.description: The supreme mystery of evil. Originally a high-ranking angel who chose rebellion. He operates through deception and accusation, holding temporary power over the world system.

entries.name: Semyaza
entries.description: Leader of the Watchers who descended on Mount Hermon. He taught enchantments and root-cutting, and bound his brethren by an oath to corrupt humanity.

entries.name: Azazel
entries.description: Azazel taught humanity the arts of war (swords, shields) and vanity (cosmetics). He corrupted the earth so thoroughly that Raphael was commanded to bind him in the desert.

entries.name: Lilith
entries.description: A female night demon associated with storms and danger to children. Later traditions identify her as Adam's first wife who refused submission and fled Eden.

entries.name: Asmodeus
entries.description: A powerful demon associated with lust and rage. In Tobit, he kills Sarah's seven husbands. He was eventually bound by Raphael.

entries.name: Belial
entries.description: Belial is the embodiment of lawlessness, leading the forces of darkness against the forces of light in the Dead Sea Scrolls war theology.

entries.name: Mastema
entries.description: The chief of evil spirits who received permission from God to retain some demons after the Flood to continue testing humanity. He acts as both accuser and punisher.

entries.name: Abaddon / Apollyon
entries.description: The angel of the bottomless pit who leads tormenting locust-like creatures during the apocalyptic judgments.

entries.name: Gadreel
entries.description: Identified in 1 Enoch as the angel who led Eve astray. He also taught humanity the art of making weapons of death.

entries.name: Prince of Persia
entries.description: A powerful territorial spirit with authority over the Persian Empire who opposed the angelic messenger sent to Daniel for 21 days.
